description: The PDF/UA version and conformance level of a file shall be specified using the PDF/UA Identification extension schema
message: The document metadata stream doesn't contain PDF/UA Identification Schema
user_friendly_message: This PDF is missing a special label that tells assistive technologies (like screen readers) that it's designed to be accessible. Without this identification, accessibility tools may not know to treat the document as accessible, which could result in a poor experience for people with disabilities who rely on these features.

description: The value of "pdfuaid:part" shall be the part number of the International Standard to which the file conforms
message: The "part" property of the PDF/UA Identification Schema is %1 instead of 1 for PDF/UA-1 conforming file
user_friendly_message: This PDF claims to follow an unrecognized version of the accessibility standard. It should be marked as following PDF/UA-1 (the current standard), but it's labeled with a different version number, which means accessibility tools may not be able to properly interpret and present the document's content to users with disabilities.

description: Property "part" of the PDF/UA Identification Schema shall have namespace prefix "pdfuaid"
message: Property "part" of the PDF/UA Identification Schema has invalid namespace prefix %1
user_friendly_message: The accessibility label in this PDF uses the wrong formatting code, making it unreadable to assistive technologies. This is like writing an address with the wrong format—the information might be there, but systems can't find or use it properly to help people with disabilities access the content.

description: Property "amd" of the PDF/UA Identification Schema shall have namespace prefix "pdfuaid"
message: Property "amd" of the PDF/UA Identification Schema has invalid namespace prefix %1
user_friendly_message: The accessibility amendment information in this PDF is labeled incorrectly, preventing assistive technologies from understanding which version of the accessibility standard the document follows. This formatting error means accessibility tools may not apply the correct rules when helping users with disabilities navigate the content.

description: Property "corr" of the PDF/UA Identification Schema shall have namespace prefix "pdfuaid"
message: Property "corr" of the PDF/UA Identification Schema has invalid namespace prefix %1
user_friendly_message: The accessibility correction information in this PDF is formatted incorrectly, which prevents assistive technologies from properly identifying the specific accessibility standard version being used. This mislabeling could cause accessibility tools to misinterpret how to best present the document to users with disabilities.

description: The file header shall consist of "%PDF-1.n" followed by a single EOL marker, where 'n' is a single digit number between 0 (30h) and 7 (37h)
message: File header %1 does not match the pattern %PDF-1.n, where 'n' is a single digit number between 0 and 7
user_friendly_message: This file's opening identifier is improperly formatted or uses an unsupported PDF version. Like a book with a damaged cover, assistive technologies may not recognize this as a valid PDF document, preventing users with disabilities from accessing any of its content.

description: The document catalog dictionary shall include a MarkInfo dictionary containing an entry, Marked, whose value shall be true
message: MarkInfo dictionary is not present in the document catalog, or Marked entry is set to false or is not present in the MarkInfo dictionary (MarkInfo = %1, Marked = %2)
user_friendly_message: This PDF is missing essential markers that tell assistive technologies how the content is structured (like headings, paragraphs, and lists). Without these markers, screen readers and other accessibility tools can't properly navigate or read the document aloud, making it extremely difficult for people with visual impairments to use.

description: Content marked as Artifact should not be present inside tagged content
message: Content marked as Artifact is present inside tagged content (parent struct element %1)
user_friendly_message: This PDF has decorative elements (like background images or design flourishes) incorrectly mixed in with the actual content structure. This confuses screen readers, which may announce these decorative items as if they were important content, creating a cluttered and confusing experience for users with visual impairments.

description: Tagged content should not be present inside content marked as Artifact
message: Tagged content (parent struct element %1) is present inside content marked as Artifact
user_friendly_message: This PDF has important content incorrectly labeled as decorative background elements. Screen readers will skip over this content entirely, meaning users with visual impairments won't hear or access information that should be available to them.

description: Content shall be marked as Artifact or tagged as real content
message: Content is neither marked as Artifact nor tagged as real content
user_friendly_message: This PDF contains content that isn't labeled as either meaningful information or decorative background. Without proper labeling, assistive technologies can't determine whether to present this content to users with disabilities, potentially causing them to miss important information or hear confusing, out-of-context fragments.

description: Files shall have a Suspects value of false(ISO 32000-1:2008, Table 321)
message: Suspects entry has a value of true
user_friendly_message: This PDF is flagged as having potentially incomplete or incorrect accessibility tagging. This warning indicates the document may have been modified after its accessibility features were created, meaning assistive technologies might encounter unexpected errors or missing information when trying to help users with disabilities access the content.

description: All non-standard structure types shall be mapped to the nearest functionally equivalent standard type, as defined in ISO 32000-1:2008, 14.8.4, in the role map dictionary of the structure tree root. This mapping may be indirect; within the role map a non-standard type can map directly to another non-standard type, but eventually the mapping shall terminate at a standard type
message: Non-standard structure type %1 is not mapped to a standard type
user_friendly_message: This PDF uses a custom label for organizing content that hasn't been connected to a standard type that assistive technologies understand. Without this connection, screen readers won't know how to interpret or announce this element, leaving users with disabilities unable to understand its purpose or navigate it properly.

description: A circular mapping shall not exist
message: A circular mapping exists for %1 structure type
user_friendly_message: This PDF has a structural labeling error where a content type points back to itself in an endless loop. This circular reference will prevent assistive technologies from understanding what type of content this is, causing them to fail or behave unpredictably when users with disabilities try to access this part of the document.

description: Standard tags defined in ISO 32000-1:2008, 14.8.4, shall not be remapped
message: Standard type %1 is remapped
user_friendly_message: This PDF has incorrectly redefined a standard content label that assistive technologies rely on. By changing what a standard label means, screen readers and other accessibility tools will misinterpret the content's structure, potentially announcing headings as paragraphs or lists as tables, creating confusion for users with disabilities.

description: The Catalog dictionary of a conforming file shall contain the Metadata key whose value is a metadata stream as defined in ISO 32000-1:2008, 14.3.2. The metadata stream dictionary shall contain entry Type with value /Metadata and entry Subtype with value /XML
message: The document catalog dictionary doesn't contain metadata key or metadata stream dictionary does not contain either entry Type with value /Metadata or entry Subtype with value /XML
user_friendly_message: This PDF is missing essential information about the document itself (like title, author, and accessibility features) or this information isn't stored in the correct format. Without proper metadata, assistive technologies can't provide users with disabilities important context about the document before they begin reading it.

description: The Metadata stream in the document's catalog dictionary shall contain a dc:title entry, where dc is the recommended prefix for the Dublin Core metadata schema as defined in the XMP specification, which clearly identifies the document
message: Metadata stream does not contain dc:title
user_friendly_message: This PDF is missing a document title in its metadata. Without a title, assistive technologies can't announce what document users are opening, forcing people with visual impairments to guess the content or rely solely on the filename, which may not be descriptive or meaningful.

description: The document catalog dictionary shall include a ViewerPreferences dictionary containing a DisplayDocTitle key, whose value shall be true
message: ViewerPreferences dictionary is not present in the document Catalog, or DisplayDocTitle key is set to false or is not present in the ViewerPreferences dictionary (ViewerPreferences = %1, DisplayDocTitle = %2)
user_friendly_message: This PDF isn't configured to display its title in the window or tab bar, showing the filename instead. This makes it harder for users with disabilities to identify and switch between open documents, especially when using screen readers that announce window titles for navigation.

description: The logical structure of the conforming file shall be described by a structure hierarchy rooted in the StructTreeRoot entry of the document catalog dictionary, as described in ISO 32000-1:2008, 14.7
message: StructTreeRoot entry is not present in the document catalog
user_friendly_message: This PDF is missing the organizational framework that defines how its content is structured (like headings, paragraphs, lists, and tables). Without this structure, screen readers can only read the document as unorganized text in visual order, making it nearly impossible for users with visual impairments to navigate or understand the content properly.

description: A structure element dictionary shall contain the P (parent) entry according to ISO 32000-1:2008, 14.7.2, Table 355
message: A structure element dictionary does not contain the P (parent) entry
user_friendly_message: This PDF has a structural element that doesn't specify what it belongs to in the document hierarchy. Without this parent relationship, assistive technologies can't understand how this content fits into the overall structure, potentially causing navigation errors or skipping content when users with disabilities try to move through the document.

description: Natural language in the Outline entries shall be determined
message: Natural language in the Outline entries cannot be determined
user_friendly_message: The bookmarks in this PDF don't specify what language they're written in. Without language information, screen readers may pronounce the bookmark text incorrectly or use the wrong pronunciation rules, making navigation confusing or unintelligible for users with visual impairments.

description: Table element may contain only TR, THead, TBody, TFoot and Caption elements
test: kidsStandardTypes.split('&').filter(elem => elem != 'TR' && elem != 'THead' && elem != 'TBody' && elem != 'TFoot' && elem != 'Caption').length == 0 || kidsStandardTypes == ''
message: Table element contains %1 element(s) instead of TR, THead, TBode, TFoot or Caption
user_friendly_message: This table contains elements that don't belong in a properly structured table. Screen readers expect tables to only have rows, headers, body sections, footers, and captions—anything else will confuse the assistive technology, making it difficult or impossible for users with disabilities to understand the table's data and organization.

description: TR element should be contained in Table, THead, TBody or TFoot element
message: TR element contained in %1 instead of Table, THead, TBody or TFoot element
user_friendly_message: A table row is placed outside of its proper table container. This is like having a row of data floating without being part of an actual table, which confuses screen readers and prevents them from announcing the row's relationship to other data, making the information incomprehensible to users with visual impairments.

description: THead element should be contained in Table element
message: THead element contained in %1 instead of Table element
user_friendly_message: The table header section is placed outside of its table. Without the header being properly nested within the table structure, screen readers can't identify which rows contain column headings, making it extremely difficult for users with disabilities to understand what each column of data represents.

description: TBody element should be contained in Table element
message: TBody element contained in %1 instead of Table element
user_friendly_message: The table body section is placed outside of its table. This structural error prevents screen readers from recognizing this as part of a table, so users with disabilities won't be able to navigate the data properly or understand its relationship to table headers and other rows.

description: TFoot element should be contained in Table element
message: TFoot element contained in %1 instead of Table element
user_friendly_message: The table footer section is placed outside of its table. Without proper nesting, screen readers can't identify this as the table's footer information (like totals or summaries), preventing users with disabilities from understanding the complete context and structure of the table data.

description: TH element should be contained in TR element
message: TH element contained in %1 instead of TR element
user_friendly_message: A table header cell is placed outside of a table row. This breaks the table structure, preventing screen readers from properly associating the header with its data and announcing row/column positions, making it impossible for users with disabilities to navigate and understand the table's organization.

description: TD element should be contained in TR element
message: TD element contained in %1 instead of TR element
user_friendly_message: A table data cell is placed outside of a table row. Without being properly contained in a row, screen readers can't announce which row and column the data belongs to, leaving users with disabilities unable to understand the data's position or relationship to headers and other cells.

description: TR element may contain only TH and TD elements
message: TR element contains %1 element(s) instead of TH or TD
user_friendly_message: This table row contains elements other than header or data cells. Screen readers expect rows to only contain cells—anything else disrupts the table structure, preventing users with disabilities from navigating between cells or understanding which content belongs in the table versus outside it.

description: Table element should contain zero or one THead kid
message: Table element contains more than one THead kid
user_friendly_message: This table has multiple header sections when it should have only one. Having more than one header confuses screen readers about which row contains the actual column headings, making it difficult for users with disabilities to understand what each column represents or navigate the table correctly.

description: Table element should contain zero or one TFoot kid
message: Table element contains more than one TFoot kid
user_friendly_message: This table has multiple footer sections when it should have only one. Multiple footers confuse screen readers about where the table ends and which information represents summary or total data, making it unclear for users with disabilities to understand the table's complete structure.

description: If Table element contains TFoot kid, Table element should contain one or more TBody kids
message: Table element contains TFoot kid, but does not contain TBody kids
user_friendly_message: This table has a footer section but no body section containing the actual data rows. This illogical structure—like having a summary without any data to summarize—will confuse screen readers and prevent users with disabilities from understanding the table's organization and content.

description: If Table element contains THead kid, Table element should contain one or more TBody kids
message: Table element contains THead kid, but does not contain TBody kids
user_friendly_message: This table has a header section but no body section containing the actual data rows. This incomplete structure—like having column headings with no data beneath them—will confuse screen readers and prevent users with disabilities from accessing the table's content or understanding its purpose.

description: A table cell shall not have intersection with other cells
message: Table cell has intersection with other cells
user_friendly_message: Table cells in this PDF overlap with each other. This causes screen readers to become confused about which content belongs to which cell and where one cell ends and another begins, making the table data incomprehensible to users with disabilities.

description: Table element may contain a Caption element as its first or last kid
message: Table element contains Caption as its %1 child instead of first or last one
user_friendly_message: This table's caption is positioned incorrectly in the middle of the table structure instead of at the beginning or end. This improper placement confuses screen readers about when to announce the caption, potentially interrupting the flow of table data and making it harder for users with disabilities to understand what the table represents.

description: LI element should be contained in L element
message: LI element contained in %1 instead of L element
user_friendly_message: A list item is placed outside of an actual list structure. Without being properly contained in a list, screen readers can't identify this as part of a list or announce how many items the list contains, preventing users with disabilities from understanding the content's organization and context.

description: LBody element should be contained in LI element
message: LBody element contained in %1 instead of LI element
user_friendly_message: The content of a list item is placed outside of the list item structure. This breaks the connection between the bullet or number and its associated text, preventing screen readers from properly announcing list items and making the list structure incomprehensible to users with disabilities.

description: L element may contain only L, LI and Caption elements
message: L element contains %1 element(s) instead of L, LI or Caption
user_friendly_message: This list contains elements that don't belong in a properly structured list. Screen readers expect lists to only contain list items, nested lists, or captions—anything else disrupts the list structure, making it difficult for users with disabilities to navigate and understand where the list begins and ends.

description: LI element may contain only Lbl and LBody elements
message: LI element contains %1 element(s) instead of Lbl or LBody
user_friendly_message: This list item contains elements other than its label (bullet or number) and body text. Screen readers expect a simple structure of marker and content—anything else confuses the assistive technology, preventing users with disabilities from understanding which text belongs to which list item.

description: Natural language for text in ActualText attribute shall be determined
test: ActualText == null || containsLang == true || parentLang != null || gContainsCatalogLang == true
message: Natural language for text in ActualText attribute cannot be determined
user_friendly_message: The replacement text provided for an element doesn't specify what language it's written in. Without language information, screen readers may pronounce this text incorrectly using the wrong language rules, making the content confusing or unintelligible for users with visual impairments.

description: Natural language for text in Alt attribute shall be determined
test: Alt == null || containsLang == true || parentLang != null || gContainsCatalogLang == true
message: Natural language for text in Alt attribute cannot be determined
user_friendly_message: The alternative text describing an image or element doesn't specify what language it's written in. Without language information, screen readers may pronounce the description incorrectly, making it difficult or impossible for users with visual impairments to understand what the image or element represents.

description: Natural language for text in E attribute shall be determined
test: E == null || containsLang == true || parentLang != null || gContainsCatalogLang == true
message: Natural language for text in E attribute cannot be determined
user_friendly_message: The expanded text for an abbreviation or acronym doesn't specify what language it's written in. Without language information, screen readers may mispronounce the full form when explaining what the abbreviation means, confusing users with visual impairments.

description: Natural language in the Contents entry for annotations shall be determined
test: Contents == null || containsLang == true || gContainsCatalogLang == true
message: Natural language in the Contents entry for annotations cannot be determined
user_friendly_message: The text content of an annotation (like a comment or note) doesn't specify what language it's written in. Without language information, screen readers may pronounce the annotation incorrectly, making it difficult for users with visual impairments to understand the comment or additional information provided.

description: Natural language in the TU key for form fields shall be determined
test: TU == null || containsLang == true || gContainsCatalogLang == true
message: Natural language in the TU key for form fields cannot be determined
user_friendly_message: The descriptive label for a form field doesn't specify what language it's written in. Without language information, screen readers may mispronounce the field's purpose or instructions, making it confusing for users with disabilities to understand what information they need to enter.

description: TOCI element should be contained in TOC element
message: TOCI element contained in %1 instead of TOC element
user_friendly_message: A table of contents item is placed outside of the table of contents structure. Without proper nesting, screen readers can't identify this as part of the navigation menu, preventing users with disabilities from using it to jump to different sections of the document.

description: TOC element may contain only TOC, TOCI and Caption elements
message: TOC element contains %1 element(s) instead of TOC, TOCI or Caption
user_friendly_message: This table of contents contains elements that don't belong in a properly structured navigation menu. Screen readers expect only TOC items, nested sections, or captions—anything else disrupts the navigation structure, making it difficult for users with disabilities to browse and jump to different parts of the document.

description: TOC element may contain a Caption element only as its first kid
message: TOC element contains Caption as its %1 child instead of first one
user_friendly_message: The caption for this table of contents appears in the wrong position instead of at the beginning. This incorrect placement confuses screen readers about when to announce what the navigation menu represents, potentially interrupting the flow and making it harder for users with disabilities to understand the TOC's purpose.

description: If the Lang entry is present in the document's Catalog dictionary or in a structure element dictionary or property list, its value shall be a language identifier as described in ISO 32000-1:2008, 14.9.2. A language identifier shall be a Language-Tag as defined in RFC 3066, Tags for the Identification of Languages
message: Value %1 of the Lang entry is not a Language-Tag
user_friendly_message: The language code in this document is incorrectly formatted and doesn't follow the international standard for language identification. Screen readers won't recognize this invalid code, so they can't apply the correct pronunciation rules, potentially making the content unintelligible to users with visual impairments.

description: Natural language for text in ActualText attribute in Span Marked Content shall be determined
test: tag != 'Span' || ActualText == null || Lang != null || inheritedLang != null || gContainsCatalogLang == true
message: Natural language for text in ActualText attribute in Span Marked Content cannot be determined
user_friendly_message: The replacement text for a marked section of content doesn't specify what language it's written in. Without language information, screen readers won't know which pronunciation rules to use, potentially announcing this text incorrectly and confusing users with visual impairments.

description: Natural language for text in Alt attribute in Span Marked Content shall be determined
test: tag != 'Span' || Alt == null || Lang != null || inheritedLang != null || gContainsCatalogLang == true
message: Natural language for text in Alt attribute in Span Marked Content cannot be determined
user_friendly_message: The alternative text for a marked section of content doesn't specify what language it's written in. Without language information, screen readers may use incorrect pronunciation rules when reading this description aloud, making it difficult for users with visual impairments to understand the content being described.

description: Natural language for text in E attribute in Span Marked Content shall be determined
test: tag != 'Span' || E == null || Lang != null || inheritedLang != null || gContainsCatalogLang == true
message: Natural language for text in E attribute in Span Marked Content cannot be determined
user_friendly_message: The expanded text for an abbreviation within a marked section doesn't specify what language it's written in. Without language information, screen readers may mispronounce the full form of the abbreviation, making it confusing for users with visual impairments to understand what the shortened term means.

description: Natural language for document metadata shall be determined
message: Natural language for document metadata cannot be determined
user_friendly_message: The document's metadata (like title, author, or description) doesn't specify what language it's written in. Without language information, screen readers may mispronounce this important document information, making it harder for users with visual impairments to identify and understand what the document is about.

description: Natural language for text in page content shall be determined
message: Natural language for text in page content cannot be determined
user_friendly_message: Some text in this document doesn't specify what language it's written in. Without language information, screen readers can't apply the correct pronunciation rules, potentially reading the text with incorrect sounds and accents that make it unintelligible to users with visual impairments.

description: THead element may contain only TR elements
message: THead element contains %1 element(s) instead of TR
user_friendly_message: The table header section contains elements other than rows. Screen readers expect table headers to only contain header rows—anything else disrupts the table structure, preventing users with disabilities from properly understanding which rows contain the column headings.

description: TBody element may contain only TR elements
message: TBody element contains %1 element(s) instead of TR
user_friendly_message: The table body section contains elements other than rows. Screen readers expect the table body to only contain data rows—anything else confuses the table structure, making it difficult for users with disabilities to navigate through the table's data correctly.

description: TFoot element may contain only TR elements
message: TFoot element contains %1 element(s) instead of TR
user_friendly_message: The table footer section contains elements other than rows. Screen readers expect table footers to only contain footer rows (like totals or summaries)—anything else disrupts the table structure, preventing users with disabilities from properly understanding the table's concluding information.

description: Table element may contain only one Caption element
message: Table element contains %1 Caption elements instead of one
user_friendly_message: This table has multiple captions when it should have only one. Having more than one caption confuses screen readers about what to announce as the table's title or description, making it unclear for users with disabilities to understand what the table represents.

description: L element may contain a Caption element only as its first kid
message: L element contains Caption as its %1 child instead of first one
user_friendly_message: This list's caption appears in the wrong position instead of at the beginning. This incorrect placement confuses screen readers about when to announce what the list represents, potentially interrupting the flow of list items and making it harder for users with disabilities to understand the list's purpose.

description: Table columns shall have the same number of rows (taking into account row spans)
message: Table columns 1 and %1 span different number of rows
user_friendly_message: The columns in this table don't line up properly—some columns have more or fewer rows than others. This irregular structure confuses screen readers about the table's dimensions and cell positions, making it extremely difficult for users with disabilities to navigate and understand the table's data relationships.

description: Table rows shall have the same number of columns (taking into account column spans)
message: Table rows 1 and %1 span different number of columns
user_friendly_message: The rows in this table don't have a consistent number of columns—some rows are wider or narrower than others. This irregular structure prevents screen readers from properly navigating the table and announcing correct column positions, making the data confusing and difficult to understand for users with disabilities.

description: Table rows shall have the same number of columns (taking into account column spans)
message: Table rows 1 and %1 span different number of columns (%2 and %3 respectively)
user_friendly_message: The rows in this table have inconsistent widths—one row has a different number of columns than another. This irregular structure prevents screen readers from properly mapping the table grid and announcing accurate cell positions, making it confusing for users with disabilities to understand how the data is organized.

description: Figure tags shall include an alternative representation or replacement text that represents the contents marked with the Figure tag as noted in ISO 32000-1:2008, 14.7.2, Table 323
message: Figure structure element neither has an alternate description nor a replacement text
user_friendly_message: This image or figure is missing a text description that explains what it shows. Without alternative text, screen readers can only announce that an image is present, leaving users with visual impairments completely unaware of the visual information, data, or context the image conveys.

description: For documents that are not strongly structured, as described in ISO 32000-1:2008, 14.8.4.3.5, heading tags shall be used as follows: (*) If any heading tags are used, H1 shall be the first. (*) A document may use more than one instance of any specific tag level. For example, a tag level may be repeated if document content requires it. (*) If document semantics require a descending sequence of headers, such a sequence shall proceed in strict numerical order and shall not skip an intervening heading level. (*) A document may increment its heading sequence without restarting at H1 if document semantics require it
message: Heading level %1 is skipped in a descending sequence of header levels
user_friendly_message: This document skips a heading level (for example, jumping from Heading 1 directly to Heading 3). Screen readers use heading levels to help users understand the document's hierarchy and navigate between sections—skipping levels breaks this logical structure, making it confusing for users with disabilities to understand how content is organized.

description: Each node in the tag tree shall contain at most one child H tag
message: A node contains more than one H tag
user_friendly_message: A section of this document has multiple heading tags when it should have only one. This confuses screen readers about which text is the actual heading, making it difficult for users with disabilities to navigate the document structure or understand the section's organization.

description: All documents shall be either strongly or weakly structured, but not both
message: Document uses both H and H# tags
user_friendly_message: This document mixes two different heading systems (generic H tags and numbered H1-H6 tags) when it should use only one approach. This inconsistent structure confuses screen readers about the document's hierarchy, making it difficult for users with disabilities to understand and navigate the organization of content.

description: All documents shall be either strongly or weakly structured, but not both
message: Document uses both H and H# tags
user_friendly_message: This document mixes two different heading systems (numbered H1-H6 tags and generic H tags) when it should use only one approach. This inconsistent structure confuses screen readers about the document's hierarchy, making it difficult for users with disabilities to understand and navigate the organization of content.

description: If the table's structure is not determinable via Headers and IDs, then structure elements of type TH shall have a Scope attribute
message: TD does not contain Headers attribute, and Headers for this table cell cannot be determined algorithmically
user_friendly_message: This table cell isn't properly connected to its column or row headers. Without this connection, screen readers can't tell users with disabilities which headers apply to each data cell, making it impossible to understand what the numbers or information in the cell represent.

description: If the table's structure is not determinable via Headers and IDs, then structure elements of type TH shall have a Scope attribute
message: TD references undefined Header(s) %1, and Headers for this table cell cannot be determined algorithmically
user_friendly_message: This table cell references header cells that don't exist in the table. Without valid header connections, screen readers can't announce which row and column labels apply to the data, leaving users with disabilities unable to understand what the cell's information represents.

description: All mathematical expressions shall be enclosed within a Formula tag as detailed in ISO 32000-1:2008, 14.8.4.5 and shall have Alt or ActualText attributes
message: Formula structure element neither has an alternate description nor a replacement text
user_friendly_message: This mathematical formula or equation is missing a text description explaining what it represents. Without alternative text, screen readers can't convey the mathematical meaning to users with visual impairments, leaving them completely unaware of important calculations, expressions, or scientific information in the document.

description: Note tag shall have ID entry
message: ID key of the Note tag is not present
user_friendly_message: This note or footnote is missing a unique identifier. Without an ID, screen readers can't properly link the note marker in the text to its corresponding explanation, making it difficult or impossible for users with disabilities to navigate between references and their associated notes.

description: Each Note tag shall have unique ID key
message: ID key %1 of the Note tag is non-unique
user_friendly_message: Multiple notes or footnotes share the same identifier when each should have a unique ID. This duplication confuses screen readers about which note corresponds to which reference marker, potentially directing users with disabilities to the wrong explanatory text when following footnote links.

description: Each optional content configuration dictionary that forms the value of the D key, or that is an element in the array that forms the value of the Configs key in the OCProperties dictionary, shall contain the Name key
message: Missing or empty Name entry of the optional content configuration dictionary
user_friendly_message: A layer or optional content group in this PDF is missing a name. Without names, users with disabilities can't identify what different layers contain when using assistive technologies to control which content is visible, making it impossible to make informed choices about what to show or hide.

description: The AS key shall not appear in any optional content configuration dictionary
message: AS key is present in the optional content configuration dictionary
user_friendly_message: This PDF's layer configuration includes a prohibited setting that can cause layers to automatically change visibility. This unpredictable behavior can confuse users with disabilities who rely on consistent content presentation, potentially causing important information to appear or disappear unexpectedly while using assistive technologies.

description: The file specification dictionary for an embedded file shall contain the non-empty F and UF keys
test: containsEF == false || (F != null && F != '' && UF != null && UF != '')
message: The file specification dictionary for an embedded file does not contain either F or UF key or at least one of the keys is empty (F = %1, UF = %2)
user_friendly_message: An embedded file attachment is missing its filename information. Without a proper filename, screen readers can't announce what file is attached, leaving users with disabilities unable to identify the attachment before opening it, which creates confusion and potential security concerns.

description: Dynamic XFA forms shall not be used
message: Dynamic XFA forms is present
user_friendly_message: This document contains a dynamic XFA form, which is not compatible with accessibility standards. These forms cannot be properly read by screen readers or other assistive technologies, making them completely inaccessible to users with disabilities who need to fill out or interact with the form.

description: An encrypted conforming file shall contain a P key in its encryption dictionary (ISO 32000-1:2008, 7.6.3.2, Table 21). The 10th bit position of the P key shall be true
message: The file is encrypted but does not contain a P entry in its encryption dictionary or the file is encrypted and does contain a P entry, but the 10th bit position of the P entry is false (P = %1, 10th bit = %2)
user_friendly_message: This encrypted PDF doesn't have the proper permission settings to allow assistive technologies to access the content. Without the correct accessibility permission, screen readers and other tools for users with disabilities will be blocked from reading the document, making it completely inaccessible.

description: An annotation, excluding annotations of subtype Widget, PrinterMark or Link, shall be nested within an Annot tag
test: Subtype == 'Widget' || Subtype == 'PrinterMark' || Subtype == 'Link' || isOutsideCropBox == true || (F & 2) == 2 || structParentStandardType == 'Annot'
message: %1 annotation is an Artifact or is nested within %2 tag (standard type = %3) instead of Annot
user_friendly_message: An annotation (like a comment or note) is incorrectly labeled as decorative or placed in the wrong structural container. This misplacement prevents screen readers from announcing the annotation to users with disabilities, causing them to miss important comments, highlights, or supplemental information in the document.

description: An annotation (except Widget annotations or hidden annotations, or those having rectangle outside the crop-box) shall have either Contents key or an Alt entry in the enclosing structure element
test: Subtype == 'Widget' || isOutsideCropBox == true || (F & 2) == 2 || (Contents != null && Contents != '') || (Alt != null && Alt != '')
message: %1 annotation whose hidden flag is not set and whose rectangle is not outside the crop-box has neither Contents key nor an Alt entry in the enclosing structure element
user_friendly_message: A visible annotation is missing both its descriptive content and alternative text. Without either description, screen readers can only tell users with disabilities that an annotation exists but can't explain what it says or represents, making the annotation's information completely inaccessible.

description: A form field shall have a TU key present or all its Widget annotations shall have alternative descriptions (in the form of an Alt entry in the enclosing structure elements)
test: isOutsideCropBox == true || (F & 2) == 2 || (TU != null && TU != '') || (Alt != null && Alt != '')
message: A form field neither has TU key nor its Widget annotations have alternative descriptions (in the form of an Alt entry in the enclosing structure element)
user_friendly_message: This form field is missing a descriptive label that explains what information should be entered. Without a label or alternative description, screen readers can't tell users with disabilities what the field is for, making it impossible to fill out the form correctly.

description: Annotations of subtype TrapNet shall not be permitted
message: An annotation of subtype TrapNet exists
user_friendly_message: This PDF contains a TrapNet annotation, which is a specialized printing feature that's not allowed in accessible documents. These annotations can interfere with how assistive technologies interpret the document, potentially causing confusion or errors for users with disabilities.

description: Every page on which there is an annotation shall contain in its page dictionary the key Tabs, and its value shall be S
message: A page with annotation(s) contains Tabs key with value %1 instead of S
user_friendly_message: A page containing annotations doesn't have the correct tab order setting. Without proper tab order, keyboard users and people using assistive technologies won't be able to navigate through annotations in a logical sequence, making it difficult to access comments, form fields, or other interactive elements on the page.

description: A Widget annotation shall be nested within a Form tag per ISO 32000-1:2008, 14.8.4.5, Table 340
message: A Widget annotation is an Artifact or is nested within %1 tag (standard type = %2) instead of Form
user_friendly_message: A form field is incorrectly labeled as decorative or placed in the wrong structural container. This misplacement prevents screen readers from identifying it as an interactive form element, making it impossible for users with disabilities to find or fill out the field.

description: If the Form element omits a Role attribute (Table 348), it shall have only one child: an object reference (14.7.4.3) identifying the widget annotation per ISO 32000-1:2008, 14.8.4.5, Table 340
message: The Form element omits a Role attribute and doesn't have only one child identifying the widget annotation
user_friendly_message: A form element is missing information about what type of field it is and doesn't properly link to its corresponding widget. This incomplete structure confuses screen readers about how to interact with the field, potentially preventing users with disabilities from entering information or understanding the field's purpose.

description: Links shall be tagged according to ISO 32000-1:2008, 14.8.4.4.2, Link Element
message: A Link annotation is an Artifact or is nested within %1 tag (standard type = %2) instead of Link
user_friendly_message: A hyperlink is incorrectly labeled as decorative or placed in the wrong structural container. This misplacement prevents screen readers from identifying it as a clickable link, making it impossible for users with disabilities to navigate to the linked content or even know that a link exists.

description: Links shall contain an alternate description via their Contents key as described in ISO 32000-1:2008, 14.9.3
message: A link annotation does not include an alternate description in the Contents key
user_friendly_message: This hyperlink is missing descriptive text explaining where it leads. Without a description, screen readers can only announce that a link exists but can't tell users with disabilities what will happen when they click it, making navigation confusing and potentially frustrating.

description: In the media clip data dictionary, the optional CT key (ISO 32000-1:2008, 13.2.4.2, Table 274) is required
message: CT key is missing from the media clip data dictionary
user_friendly_message: An embedded media clip (like audio or video) is missing information about its file type. Without this information, assistive technologies can't determine how to handle the media or inform users with disabilities what type of content they're encountering, potentially preventing them from accessing it properly.

description: In the media clip data dictionary, the optional Alt key (ISO 32000-1:2008, 13.2.4.2, Table 274) is required
message: Alt key (value %1) is missing from the media clip data dictionary or has incorrect value
user_friendly_message: An embedded media clip (like audio or video) is missing or has an invalid alternative text description. Without a proper description, users with disabilities who can't see or hear the media have no way to know what content it contains, excluding them from important information.

description: PrinterMark annotations, if present, shall be considered Incidental Artifacts, as if they are hidden page elements as defined in ISO 32000-1:2008, 14.8.2.2.3
message: A PrinterMark annotation is included in logical structure
user_friendly_message: A printer's mark (a technical symbol used for professional printing) is incorrectly included in the document structure as meaningful content. These marks should be hidden from assistive technologies—including them causes screen readers to announce irrelevant printing information, creating unnecessary clutter and confusion for users with disabilities.

description: A conforming file shall not contain any reference XObjects
message: The document contains a reference XObject (Ref key in the form XObject dictionary)
user_friendly_message: This PDF contains a reference to external content that isn't fully embedded in the document. Referenced content can cause accessibility problems because assistive technologies may not be able to access or properly interpret content that isn't completely contained within the file, potentially leaving users with disabilities missing important information.

description: The content of Form XObjects shall be incorporated into structure elements according to ISO 32000-1:2008, 14.7.2
message: Form XObject contains MCIDs and is referenced more than once
user_friendly_message: A reusable graphic element with structure information appears multiple times in the document. This creates confusion for assistive technologies about how to handle the structural markers, potentially causing screen readers to announce content incorrectly or skip important information when users with disabilities encounter these repeated elements.

description: For any given composite (Type 0) font within a conforming file, the CIDSystemInfo entry in its CIDFont dictionary and its Encoding dictionary shall have the following relationship: - If the Encoding key in the Type 0 font dictionary is Identity-H or Identity-V, any values of Registry, Ordering, and Supplement may be used in the CIDSystemInfo entry of the CIDFont. - Otherwise, the corresponding Registry and Ordering strings in both CIDSystemInfo dictionaries shall be identical, and the value of the Supplement key in the CIDSystemInfo dictionary of the CIDFont shall be less than or equal to the Supplement key in the CIDSystemInfo dictionary of the CMap
test: cmapName == "Identity-H" || cmapName == "Identity-V" || (CIDFontOrdering != null && CIDFontOrdering == CMapOrdering && CIDFontRegistry != null && CIDFontRegistry == CMapRegistry && CIDFontSupplement != null && CMapSupplement != null && CIDFontSupplement <= CMapSupplement)
message: CIDSystemInfo entries the CIDFont and CMap dictionaries of a Type 0 font are not compatible (CIDSystemInfo Ordering = %1, CMap Ordering = %2, CIDSystemInfo Registry = %3, CMap Registry = %4, CIDSystemInfo Supplement = %5, CMap Supplement = %6)
user_friendly_message: The font encoding information in this document is inconsistent, which can cause text extraction problems. When assistive technologies try to read the text, they may encounter garbled characters, missing words, or completely unreadable content, making the document inaccessible to users with visual impairments who rely on screen readers.

description: ISO 32000-1:2008, 9.7.4, Table 117 requires that all embedded Type 2 CIDFonts in the CIDFont dictionary shall contain a CIDToGIDMap entry that shall be a stream mapping from CIDs to glyph indices or the name Identity, as described in ISO 32000-1:2008, 9.7.4, Table 117
message: A Type 2 CIDFont dictionary has missing or invalid CIDToGIDMap entry
user_friendly_message: A font in this document is missing critical mapping information that tells the system which character symbols to display. Without this mapping, text may appear as incorrect characters or boxes when assistive technologies try to extract it, making the content unreadable for users with disabilities who rely on screen readers.

description: All CMaps used within a PDF/UA file, except those listed in ISO 32000-1:2008, 9.7.5.2, Table 118, shall be embedded in that file as described in ISO 32000-1:2008, 9.7.5
test: CMapName == "Identity-H" || CMapName == "Identity-V" || CMapName == "GB-EUC-H" || CMapName == "GB-EUC-V" || CMapName == "GBpc-EUC-H" || CMapName == "GBpc-EUC-V" || CMapName == "GBK-EUC-H" || CMapName == "GBK-EUC-V" || CMapName == "GBKp-EUC-H" || CMapName == "GBKp-EUC-V" || CMapName == "GBK2K-H" || CMapName == "GBK2K-V" || CMapName == "UniGB-UCS2-H" || CMapName == "UniGB-UCS2-V" || CMapName == "UniGB-UTF16-H" || CMapName == "UniGB-UTF16-V" || CMapName == "B5pc-H" || CMapName == "B5pc-V" || CMapName == "HKscs-B5-H" || CMapName == "HKscs-B5-V" || CMapName == "ETen-B5-H" || CMapName == "ETen-B5-V" || CMapName == "ETenms-B5-H" || CMapName == "ETenms-B5-V" || CMapName == "CNS-EUC-H" || CMapName == "CNS-EUC-V" || CMapName == "UniCNS-UCS2-H" || CMapName == "UniCNS-UCS2-V" || CMapName == "UniCNS-UTF16-H" || CMapName == "UniCNS-UTF16-V" || CMapName == "83pv-RKSJ-H" || CMapName == "90ms-RKSJ-H" || CMapName == "90ms-RKSJ-V" || CMapName == "90msp-RKSJ-H" || CMapName == "90msp-RKSJ-V" || CMapName == "90pv-RKSJ-H" || CMapName == "Add-RKSJ-H" || CMapName == "Add-RKSJ-V" || CMapName == "EUC-H" || CMapName == "EUC-V" || CMapName == "Ext-RKSJ-H" || CMapName == "Ext-RKSJ-V" || CMapName == "H" || CMapName == "V" || CMapName == "UniJIS-UCS2-H" || CMapName == "UniJIS-UCS2-V" || CMapName == "UniJIS-UCS2-HW-H" || CMapName == "UniJIS-UCS2-HW-V" || CMapName == "UniJIS-UTF16-H" || CMapName == "UniJIS-UTF16-V" || CMapName == "KSC-EUC-H" || CMapName == "KSC-EUC-V" || CMapName == "KSCms-UHC-H" || CMapName == "KSCms-UHC-V" || CMapName == "KSCms-UHC-HW-H" || CMapName == "KSCms-UHC-HW-V" || CMapName == "KSCpc-EUC-H" || CMapName == "UniKS-UCS2-H" || CMapName == "UniKS-UCS2-V" || CMapName == "UniKS-UTF16-H" || CMapName == "UniKS-UTF16-V" || containsEmbeddedFile == true
message: A non-standard CMap %1 is not embedded
user_friendly_message: This document uses a custom character mapping table that isn't included in the file. Without the embedded mapping, assistive technologies won't know how to correctly interpret the text characters, potentially causing garbled or missing text when screen readers try to read the content to users with visual impairments.

description: For those CMaps that are embedded, the integer value of the WMode entry in the CMap dictionary shall be identical to the WMode value in the embedded CMap stream
message: WMode entry (value %1) in the embedded CMap and in the CMap dictionary (value %2) are not identical
user_friendly_message: The text direction setting (horizontal or vertical) is inconsistent between the font's mapping information and its embedded data. This mismatch can cause assistive technologies to read text in the wrong direction or order, making the content confusing or completely unintelligible for users with disabilities.

description: A CMap shall not reference any other CMap except those listed in ISO 32000-1:2008, 9.7.5.2, Table 118
test: CMapName == "Identity-H" || CMapName == "Identity-V" || CMapName == "GB-EUC-H" || CMapName == "GB-EUC-V" || CMapName == "GBpc-EUC-H" || CMapName == "GBpc-EUC-V" || CMapName == "GBK-EUC-H" || CMapName == "GBK-EUC-V" || CMapName == "GBKp-EUC-H" || CMapName == "GBKp-EUC-V" || CMapName == "GBK2K-H" || CMapName == "GBK2K-V" || CMapName == "UniGB-UCS2-H" || CMapName == "UniGB-UCS2-V" || CMapName == "UniGB-UTF16-H" || CMapName == "UniGB-UTF16-V" || CMapName == "B5pc-H" || CMapName == "B5pc-V" || CMapName == "HKscs-B5-H" || CMapName == "HKscs-B5-V" || CMapName == "ETen-B5-H" || CMapName == "ETen-B5-V" || CMapName == "ETenms-B5-H" || CMapName == "ETenms-B5-V" || CMapName == "CNS-EUC-H" || CMapName == "CNS-EUC-V" || CMapName == "UniCNS-UCS2-H" || CMapName == "UniCNS-UCS2-V" || CMapName == "UniCNS-UTF16-H" || CMapName == "UniCNS-UTF16-V" || CMapName == "83pv-RKSJ-H" || CMapName == "90ms-RKSJ-H" || CMapName == "90ms-RKSJ-V" || CMapName == "90msp-RKSJ-H" || CMapName == "90msp-RKSJ-V" || CMapName == "90pv-RKSJ-H" || CMapName == "Add-RKSJ-H" || CMapName == "Add-RKSJ-V" || CMapName == "EUC-H" || CMapName == "EUC-V" || CMapName == "Ext-RKSJ-H" || CMapName == "Ext-RKSJ-V" || CMapName == "H" || CMapName == "V" || CMapName == "UniJIS-UCS2-H" || CMapName == "UniJIS-UCS2-V" || CMapName == "UniJIS-UCS2-HW-H" || CMapName == "UniJIS-UCS2-HW-V" || CMapName == "UniJIS-UTF16-H" || CMapName == "UniJIS-UTF16-V" || CMapName == "KSC-EUC-H" || CMapName == "KSC-EUC-V" || CMapName == "KSCms-UHC-H" || CMapName == "KSCms-UHC-V" || CMapName == "KSCms-UHC-HW-H" || CMapName == "KSCms-UHC-HW-V" || CMapName == "KSCpc-EUC-H" || CMapName == "UniKS-UCS2-H" || CMapName == "UniKS-UCS2-V" || CMapName == "UniKS-UTF16-H" || CMapName == "UniKS-UTF16-V"
message: A CMap references another non-standard CMap %1
user_friendly_message: A character mapping table in this document references another custom mapping that may not be available. This chain of dependencies can prevent assistive technologies from properly understanding the text characters, potentially making the content unreadable for users with visual impairments who rely on screen readers.

description: The font programs for all fonts used for rendering within a conforming file shall be embedded within that file, as defined in ISO 32000-1:2008, 9.9
message: The font program is not embedded
user_friendly_message: The actual font files used in this document aren't included in the PDF. Without embedded fonts, assistive technologies may substitute different fonts that don't have the correct character information, causing text extraction errors that make the content garbled or unreadable for users with visual impairments.

description: Embedded fonts shall define all glyphs referenced for rendering within the conforming file. A font referenced solely in text rendering mode 3 is not rendered and is thus exempt from the requirements that impact the visual representation of the glyphs of a font. In all cases for TrueType fonts that are to be rendered, character codes shall be able to be mapped to glyphs according to ISO 32000-1:2008, 9.6.6.4 without the use of a non-standard mapping chosen by the conforming processor
message: Not all glyphs referenced for rendering are present in the embedded font program
user_friendly_message: Some characters used in this document are missing from the embedded font. When assistive technologies try to extract text, these missing characters will appear as blanks or incorrect symbols, making portions of the content unreadable or meaningless for users with visual impairments who rely on screen readers.

description: If the FontDescriptor dictionary of an embedded Type 1 font contains a CharSet string, then it shall list the character names of all glyphs present in the font program, regardless of whether a glyph in the font is referenced or used by the PDF or not
test: containsFontFile == false || fontName.search(/[A-Z]{6}\+/) != 0 || CharSet == null || charSetListsAllGlyphs == true
message: A CharSet entry in the Descriptor dictionary of a Type1 font incorrectly lists glyphs present in the font program
user_friendly_message: The character list for a font in this document is incomplete or incorrect. This mismatch between the font's character inventory and its actual contents can prevent assistive technologies from properly extracting text, causing missing or garbled characters when screen readers try to read the content to users with visual impairments.

description: If the FontDescriptor dictionary of an embedded CID font contains a CIDSet stream, then it shall identify all CIDs which are present in the font program, regardless of whether a CID in the font is referenced or used by the PDF or not
test: containsFontFile == false || fontName.search(/[A-Z]{6}\+/) != 0 || containsCIDSet == false || cidSetListsAllGlyphs == true
message: A CIDSet entry in the Font descriptor does not correctly identify all glyphs present in the embedded font subset
user_friendly_message: The character identification list for a font subset in this document doesn't accurately reflect which characters are actually included. This discrepancy can confuse assistive technologies about which characters are available, potentially causing text extraction errors that make content unreadable for users with visual impairments.

description: For every font embedded in a conforming file and used for rendering, the glyph width information in the font dictionary and in the embedded font program shall be consistent
test: renderingMode == 3 || widthFromFontProgram == null || widthFromDictionary == null || Math.abs(widthFromFontProgram - widthFromDictionary) <= 1
message: Glyph width %1 in the embedded font program is not consistent with the Widths entry of the font dictionary (value %2)
user_friendly_message: The character width information is inconsistent between the font's dictionary and the actual embedded font. This mismatch can cause assistive technologies to incorrectly extract text—words may run together, spacing may disappear, or character order may be scrambled—making the content difficult or impossible to read for users with visual impairments.

description: For all non-symbolic TrueType fonts used for rendering, the embedded TrueType font program shall contain one or several non-symbolic cmap entries such that all necessary glyph lookups can be carried out
message: The embedded font program for a non-symbolic TrueType font does not contain non-symbolic cmap entries
user_friendly_message: A TrueType font in this document is missing the character mapping tables needed to identify text characters. Without these mappings, assistive technologies can't translate the visual glyphs into readable text, making the content completely inaccessible to users with visual impairments who rely on screen readers.

description: All non-symbolic TrueType fonts shall have either MacRomanEncoding or WinAnsiEncoding as the value for the Encoding key in the Font dictionary or as the value for the BaseEncoding key in the dictionary which is the value of the Encoding key in the Font dictionary. In addition, no non-symbolic TrueType font shall define a Differences array unless all of the glyph names in the Differences array are listed in the Adobe Glyph List and the embedded font program contains at least the Microsoft Unicode (3,1 – Platform ID=3, Encoding ID=1) encoding in the 'cmap' table
test: isSymbolic == true || ((Encoding == "MacRomanEncoding" || Encoding == "WinAnsiEncoding") && (containsDifferences == false || differencesAreUnicodeCompliant == true))
message: A non-symbolic TrueType font encoding does not define a correct mapping to the Adobe Glyph List (Encoding = %1, Encoding entry contains a Differences = %2, Differences are Unicode compliant = %3)
user_friendly_message: A font's character encoding doesn't properly map to standard character definitions. This incorrect mapping prevents assistive technologies from accurately converting the visual text into readable characters, potentially causing garbled text or complete reading failures for users with visual impairments who rely on screen readers.

description: Symbolic TrueType fonts shall not contain an Encoding entry in the font dictionary
message: A symbolic TrueType font specifies an Encoding entry in its dictionary
user_friendly_message: A symbolic font (used for special characters or icons) incorrectly includes character encoding information. This unnecessary encoding can confuse assistive technologies about how to interpret the symbols, potentially causing them to announce meaningless text instead of properly handling the symbolic content for users with disabilities.

description: The 'cmap' table in the embedded font program for a symbolic TrueType font shall contain either exactly one encoding or it shall contain, at least, the Microsoft Symbol (3,0 - Platform ID=3, Encoding ID=0) encoding
message: The embedded font program for a symbolic TrueType font contains %1 cmap subtables and does not contain Microsoft Symbol (3,0 – Platform ID=3, Encoding ID=0)
user_friendly_message: A symbolic font's character mapping table has the wrong structure for special characters. Without the correct symbol encoding, assistive technologies can't properly interpret these special characters or symbols, potentially announcing them incorrectly or skipping them entirely for users with visual impairments.

description: The Font dictionary of all fonts shall define the map of all used character codes to Unicode values, either via a ToUnicode entry, or other mechanisms as defined in ISO 14289-1, 7.21.7
message: The glyph can not be mapped to Unicode
user_friendly_message: A character in this document cannot be converted to standard Unicode text. Without Unicode mapping, assistive technologies have no way to identify what this character is, causing it to be skipped or replaced with a placeholder when screen readers try to read the content to users with visual impairments.

description: The Unicode values specified in the ToUnicode CMap shall all be greater than zero (0), but not equal to either U+FEFF or U+FFFE
message: The glyph has Unicode value 0, U+FEFF or U+FFFE, which is invalid by Unicode standard
user_friendly_message: A character has been assigned an invalid Unicode value that's either zero or a reserved code. These invalid values cause assistive technologies to skip or mishandle the character, potentially creating gaps or errors in the text that make content incomplete or confusing for users with visual impairments.

description: A PDF/UA compliant document shall not contain a reference to the .notdef glyph from any of the text showing operators, regardless of text rendering mode, in any content stream
message: The document contains a reference to the .notdef glyph
user_friendly_message: This document references a ".notdef" character, which is a placeholder for missing or undefined glyphs. When assistive technologies encounter this placeholder, they can't provide meaningful text to users with visual impairments, resulting in gaps or unintelligible content where actual characters should appear.
